pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:5.1: 4. The training rule on asking for something else
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā was sick.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.3: A lay follower approached her and asked,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.4: “Venerable, what’s wrong with you? What may I get for you?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.6: That lay follower then brought back ghee to the value of a _kahāpaṇa_ coin from a shop and gave it to Thullanandā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.10: The lay follower then returned to that shopkeeper and said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.11: “It seems the nun doesn’t need ghee, but oil.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.12: Here’s your ghee; please give me oil.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.13: “Sir, if we were to take back goods that have been bought, when would our goods be sold?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.14: When ghee is bought, ghee is taken away. Buying oil, you receive that, and you’ll take that away.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.15: That lay follower then complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:6.16: “How could Venerable Thullanandā ask for one thing and then for something else?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of that lay follower,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:7.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:7.3: Those nuns then told the monks,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:7.4: who in turn told the Master. …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:7.5: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:7.8: How can the nun Thullanandā ask for one thing and then for something else?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:7.9: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:7.10: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:8.1: ‘If a nun asks for one thing and then for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:11.2: apart from that thing, if she asks for something else, then the effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:11.3: When she obtains it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:11.4: It is to be relinquished to the Order of nuns, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:11.5: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished in this way.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:11.7: … ‘Venerables, this thing which I asked for after asking for something else is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Order.’ …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:12.1: If it is something else and she perceives it as something else, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:12.2: If it is something else, but she is unsure if it is, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:12.3: If it is something else, but she does not perceives it as something else, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:13.1: If it is not something else, but she perceives it as something else, and she asks for that, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:13.2: If it is not something else, but she is unsure of it, and she asks for that, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:13.3: If it is not something else, and she does not perceives it as something else, and she asks for that, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:14.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:15.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
